intro: Gynoxys arnicae var. scandens, commonly known as the scandent gynoxys, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a faint aromatic scent. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are hairy and twining. This plant is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and shrublands.
